verses.roman:
aṅgane āsiyā teṅho nā kaila sambhāṣa
tāhā dekhi' kruddha hañā bale rāmadāsa

synonyms: aṅgane—to the courtyard; āsiyā—coming; teṅho—he; nā—not; kaila—did; sambhāṣa—address; tāhā dekhi'-seeing this; kruddha hañā—becoming angry; bale—says; rāma-dāsa—Śrī Rāmadāsa.
translation: When Mīnaketana was seated in the yard, this brāhmaṇa did not offer him respect. Seeing this, Śrī Rāmadāsa became angry and spoke.
